Summarize Cross-Study Risk Scores

Source: R/SummarizeCrossStudy.R
SummarizeCrossStudy.Rd

`r lifecycle::badge("experimental")`

Creates a summary table showing cross-study site risk score metrics including number of studies, average and maximum risk scores, and investigator names.

Usage

SummarizeCrossStudy(
  dfResults,
  strGroupLevel = "Site",
  dfGroups = NULL,
  strNameCol = "InvestigatorLastName"
)

Arguments

dfResults

`data.frame` A data frame containing results from multiple studies.

strGroupLevel

`character` The group level to summarize. Default is 'Site'.

dfGroups

`data.frame` Optional. A data frame containing group metadata (for InvestigatorName lookup). Must include StudyID, GroupID, Param, and Value columns.

strNameCol

`character` The column name in dfGroups to use for investigator names. Default is 'InvestigatorLastName'.

Value

`data.frame` Summary table with the following columns: - GroupID: Site identifier - NumStudies: Number of studies the site participates in - AvgRiskScore: Average site risk score across studies - MaxRiskScore: Maximum site risk score across studies - InvestigatorName: Investigator name (if dfGroups provided)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# See inst/examples/Example_CrossStudySRS.Rmd
} # }
